newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa's ANC congratulates Kabila.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa's ANC congratulates Kabila.

text.p: South Africa's ruling African National Congress congratulated rebel leader Laurent Kabila on Sunday for winning power in Zaire.
"The ANC congratulates President Laurent Kabila and the Alliance of Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Congo on their victory in the Democratic Republic of Congo," it said in a statement.

Kabila proclaimed himself in charge of Zaire, which he immediately renamed, as his forces entered the capital Kinshasa on Saturday and departed president Mobutu Sese Seko's rag-tag army switched sides or fled.

The ANC said the relatively bloodless power transfer from President Mobutu Sese Seko's 32-year reign was a tribute to South African President Nelson Mandela and his deputy Thabo Mbeki, who have played central roles in peace initiatives.
Mbeki went to Lubumbashi on Sunday afternoon for talks with Kabila to ensure a democratic transfer of power.

Mandela's spokesman Parks Mankahlana said on Saturday the president would ask his representatives to speak to all remaining players including the presidential guard, military and members of Mobutu's party and opposition parties.

"The ANC is further pleased to note President Kabila has committed himself to the establishment of a constituent assembly to discuss the constitution for the people of the Democratic Republic of Congo."
